title: Saudi Press Attaché pays heartfelt tribute to Quaid-e-Azam on 75th death anniversary
content:
ISLAMABAD, Sep 11 (APP): Saudi Press Attaché, Dr. Naif Al-Otaibi, on Monday, paid a heartfelt tribute on the 75th death anniversary of Quaid-e-Azam Muhammad Ali Jinnah and emphasized the enduring legacy of Pakistan’s founding father, noting that great individuals may depart, yet their life stories continued to inspire and guide nations towards progress.
Talking to APP, he highlighted Jinnah’s pivotal role in the struggle for independence and the subsequent establishment of Pakistan in 1947 adding that his unwavering commitment to securing a separate homeland for Muslims in the Indian subcontinent shaped the course of history.
Dr. Al-Otaibi remarked that Jinnah’s life story stood as a testament to the power of determination, leadership, and the pursuit of justice and his resolute dedication to Pakistan’s cause served as a guiding light for all nations.
He also underscored the shared values and historical ties between Saudi Arabia and Pakistan, emphasizing their strong diplomatic relations spanning decades. “Quaid-e-Azam’s devotion to unity, faith, and discipline aligns with Saudi Arabia’s vision for the future. We are equally committed to progress and development, drawing inspiration from his remarkable journey,” he added.
Furthermore, Dr. Al-Otaibi praised Pakistan’s achievements across various domains and its contributions to regional and global peace. He stressed the importance of nurturing cultural and diplomatic ties between nations to promote mutual understanding and cooperation.
In conclusion, Dr. Al-Otaibi highlighted that Jinnah’s legacy continued to inspire not only Pakistanis but also people worldwide. He said his vision, dedication, and unwavering commitment to the principles of justice and equality continued to shape a nation’s destiny, offering valuable lessons to all aspiring to build a brighter future.
